description: Monitors spark and EKS metrics using Prometheus in Kubernetes

panels.description:
The phase state timeline of all job pods (driver, executor(s) and job-runner)

If this graph looks convoluted, try selecting  less executors as it can only show so many pods at a time

targets.expr:
(
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$Pod", container!="", phase="Failed"}*5) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$Pod",container!="", phase="Pending"}*3) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$Pod",container!="", phase="Running"}*2) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$Pod",container!="", phase="Succeeded"}*4) + scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$Pod",container!="", phase="Unknown"}*1)
)

scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$job_runner_pod", container!="", phase="Failed"}*5) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$job_runner_pod",container!="", phase="Pending"}*3) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$job_runner_pod", container!="", phase="Running"}*2) + 
scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$job_runner_pod",container!="", phase="Succeeded"}*4) + scalar(kube_pod_status_phase{pod="$job_runner_pod", container!="", phase="Unknown"}*1)

panels.title: Phase State Timeline

targets.expr: avg(1 - label_replace(sum(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle",container!=""}[5m]) ) by (cpu, instance), "host_ip", "$1","instance", "(.*):.*")) by (host_ip) and on (host_ip) kube_pod_info{created_by_name="$Pod"}

avg(1 - label_replace(sum(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle",container!=""}[5m]) ) by (cpu, instance), "host_ip", "$1","instance", "(.*):.*")) by (host_ip) and on (host_ip) kube_pod_info{pod="$Pod"}

title: Spark - EMR On EKS
